reviews.review: Forgot I bought this game with the full half life 2 pack years and years ago, and decided to finally give it a try. Can run on a toaster and plays well on it too - great laptop game for travelling and university and suchlike where you don't have a desktop or decent laptop. Surprisingly challenging at parts as well - they don't make em like they used to. Cheap as chips and cheaper on sale: well worth a buy with some leftover steam wallet funds, if you haven't already.

Played it after released more than 20 years. Still an amazing game.
While it is a older game, I still feel the nostalgia from playing it 20 years later and to be honost, it still feels fun and immersive to this day. <3 Love you Half-Life.
Un excelente juego. Con una jugabilidad  increible. 100% recomendado.
Ah yes, the one and only Half-Life. A masterpiece and a game that raised the bar (or crowbar) for so many other titles. Still a very playable game to this day!

Holds it's age well for a game from 1998, with a couple of slight annoyances. Running and shooting is fast and satisfying though the movement is somewhat slippery which can be annoying during jumping puzzles. Jumping in the air you can't increase momentum but can stop leading to some accidental deaths when you try to slow down and speed up only to fall like a stone. Story telling is pretty minimalist with a couple of the much copied and pasted NPCs (necessary of course with limitations of the time) having special dialogue lines to provide freeman with the information about the situation. This works well in giving you a sense of immersion and doesn't slow you down; the game being consistent rollercoaster of action allows you to really go at whatever pace you like to clear through the zones.

A few gripes I have with this game are: One, an annoying glitch where you can get stuck on surface edges, I don't know what causes this but it was a slight annoyance while trying to dodge enemy fire in a few places.

-Two, the game has some pretty cool soundtracks but each one only seems to play once (they don't repeat at all) meaning they are spread pretty thinly through the game.

-Three, the final boss. He has two moves, one which teleports you away to rooms with enemies and jumping puzzles and another which deals a bunch of damage (enough to kill you if you don't at least dodge some of it). The teleport wouldn't be so bad except he does it so frequently you hardly get a chance to actually damage the bugger before he sends you away again. Also you have to get in the air above the boss to hit him and with the lack of air control mentioned earlier you can't dodge his attacks while in the air. Eventually at this stage of the game I became frustrated enough with their cheap tricks so that I decided to use a cheat that stops enemies from attacking you at all to finish the game.

I'd still recommend the game though as the majority of it was quite fun, the enemy ai is pretty good too considering the time it was made (especially for the human soldiers). Also this game has a massive modding community so if you're into that sort of thing you will get a lot of mileage out of this purchase.
Just playing this game. Please don't spoil.

The classic half-life, one of the best games out there.

I have been waiting for some time to jump into this game, and i wasn't dissappointed. The only thing i am not 100% satisfied with is the puzzles. Some of them were so hard i had to look up a guide, and some of them doesn't even tell you what to do. The only other thing i am a little annoyed at is that the game likes to depleet my HP, not give me any sort of health, and then throw me into a huge arena filled with marines and a tank. Away from that though, it's a pretty good game.
Caused an catastrophic event on my first day at work, then got to kill things. 10/10
This game is a classic that will always be remembered once you play it. (If you want an HD one go to https://store.steampowered.com/app/362890/Black_Mesa/ THIS GAME IS NOT FINISHED)
